objects.name: Analytic 1484
objects.description: sshd, socat, or custom binaries initiating port forwarding or encapsulating traffic (e.g., RDP, SMB) through SSH or HTTP. Defender sees abnormal connect/bind syscalls, encrypted traffic on ports typically used for non-encrypted services, and outlier traffic volume patterns.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: socket/connect calls showing SSH processes forwarding arbitrary ports

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: linux:syslog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: sshd sessions with unusual port forwarding parameters

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: linux:osquery
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: socat, ssh, or nc processes opening unexpected ports

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Specific sshd config flags indicating port forwarding.
Define expected application protocols by port to catch tunneling mismatches.
